What would make me most angry... It's sort of complex, and only really applies to me personally so I don't know if this would get anybody else riled up, but I'll do my best to explain. Ever since I was younger, I had certain intense sort of spiritual experiences that came, sometimes from reading books, (like Siddhartha, Catcher in the Rye, novels of Charles Bukowski,) sometimes while having conversations with my father, sometimes after being in a humiliating social situations, sometimes while doing nothing at all. These experiences all made me feel much closer to the world and the state of existence in general, but farther from other people. It seemed to me that everybody I knew acted in some sort of phony way and didn't really understand anything. I notice that much less now and have a much more optimistic view about people, but I still feel that I am hyper-attuned to people who don't properly think about the state of being, who are dishonest with themselves about what the truth really is. And to me, as someone who lives in a deeply liberal community, it seems like the liberal side of the political spectrum has run completely off the rails with regard to being honest with themselves and others about the true state of things.
